intro: Galium turgaicum, commonly known as the Turgai bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a slightly aromatic scent. Galium turgaicum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
